summary: Today I focused on competitive programming, specifically solving problems for AtCoder Beginner Contest 440. I spent significant time debugging a C++ `std::vector` assertion error and researching data structures.
activities: Solved AtCoder ABC440 Problem A (Octave) and B (Trifecta) using C++
Debugged Problem C (Striped Horse) which was hitting a Runtime Error
Researched `std::set` vs `std::vector` performance in C++ for optimization
Read AtCoder editorial for ABC440 Problem C
Browsed generic competitive programming tips on Qiita and Zenn
learnings: C++ Memory Management: Accessing vector indices out of bounds triggers hard assertions in `stl_vector.h`
Data Structures: `std::set` is useful for maintaining unique elements but has higher overhead than sorted vectors
facts: Fixed: Vector out-of-bounds error in c.cpp
next_steps: Retrying ABC440 Problem C with the new approach from the editorial
